channel.title: Events | CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN
channel.description: The Civil Society 7 (C7) Group is one of the official Engagement Groups of the G7 and represents positions from the international civil society.

item.title: Join us for the C7 Handover Event on 21 November 2023
item.dc:creator: c7Admin
item.description:
The G7 Hiroshima Summit is almost over, though we still have two more Ministerial Meetings, Trade Ministers’ Meeting this weekend in Osaka, and Interior and Security Ministers’ Meeting in December, in Mito, and the new presidency is around the corner. We, Civil7, are also handing over the process from Japan to Italy, and you are […]

The post Join us for the C7 Handover Event on 21 November 2023 first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.
item.content:encoded:
The G7 Hiroshima Summit is almost over, though we still have two more Ministerial Meetings, Trade Ministers’ Meeting this weekend in Osaka, and Interior and Security Ministers’ Meeting in December, in Mito, and the new presidency is around the corner.
We, Civil7, are also handing over the process from Japan to Italy, and you are all invited to join the C7 official hand over event on 21 November in Rome, Italy, and virtually.

We will share reflections and challenges of C7 activities, and representatives of the C7 Working Groups will speak about what were effective and what can be improved for policy advocacy. We will also announce some updates for C7 2024.

Please register through the link below.
https://forms.gle/BckYAn368j1QMWft6

Date: Tuesday 21, November 2023
Time: 08:30-10:30 EST / 14:30-16:30 CET / 22:30-24:30 JST
Format: Hybrid
Place: Save the Children Italia office (Piazza di San Francesco di Paola, 9, 00184 Roma, Italy)
Organiser: C7 2023
Registration: https://forms.gle/BckYAn368j1QMWft6

Objectives:
-To understand the C7 process in order to prepare for 2024
-To reflect achievements and challenges of activities by C7 2023 and share among participants
-To demonstrate partnership and collaboration among C7 colleagues

Programs (all time in CET):
14:30-14:35 Welcome and Opening Remarks
            –Valeria Emmi, GCAP Italy, CESVI / C7 Steering Committee

14:35-14:50 Overall Reflection and Challenges of C7 activities in 2023
            –Aoi Horiuchi, JANIC / C7 Steering Committee

14:50-15:05 C7 Monitoring and Evaluation: Key Findings
            –Kamaladevy Sivalingam, Play for Change

15:05-16:15 Policy Recommendations and Reflections by C7 Working Groups
            -Moderator: Darron Seller-Peritz, Cooperation Canada
            -Speakers:

             (tbc) , C7 Nuclear Disarmament Working Group
             Risa Endo, C7 Climate and Environmental Justice Working Group
             Shoko Uchida, C7 Economic Justice and Transformation Working Group
             Masaki Inaba, C7 Global Health Working Group
             Yuko Shibata, C7 Humanitarian Assistance and Conflict Working Group
             Narayan Adhikari, C7 Open and Resilient Societies Working Group

             Followed by Q&A

16:15-16:20 Announcement for the C7 2024 (C7 Steering Committee, Working Groups, Timelines etc.)

16:20-16:25 Official hand over ceremony from C7 Japan to C7 Italy
            –Aoi Horiuchi, JANIC / C7 Steering Committee
            –Riccardo Moro, GCAP Italy

16:25-16:30 Closing Remarks
            –Mariko Kinai and Hiroki Matsubara / C7 2023 Steering Committee (online)
Contact: Civil7 Secretariat <info@civil7.org>

The post Join us for the C7 Handover Event on 21 November 2023 first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.

item.title: Women as Key Players in Development – Open dialogue with G7 & G20 stakeholders
item.dc:creator: c7Admin
item.description:
During the UN High-Level Political Forum (HLPF) in 2023, there will be an event “Women as Key Players in Development – Open dialogue with G7 & G20 stakeholders” to be held on 11 July by Women’s Major Group. It will aim to open up a space for dialogue between G7 & G20 member states, W20, […]

The post Women as Key Players in Development – Open dialogue with G7 & G20 stakeholders first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.
item.content:encoded:
During the UN High-Level Political Forum (HLPF) in 2023, there will be an event “Women as Key Players in Development – Open dialogue with G7 & G20 stakeholders” to be held on 11 July by Women’s Major Group.

It will aim to open up a space for dialogue between G7 & G20 member states, W20, C20 and W7 engagement groups and the WMG on our priorities and main messages towards HLPF & the SDG Summit, with regards to gender equality, women in development and women’s human rights. The details are as follows:

■ Date: 11 July 2023
■ Time: 9:30 to 10:30am
■ Venue: UN Church Center 2nd Floor

In order to participate, please RSVP through this link:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd921QPe0O3fMIi2F6k0jSfjb_VjQTDXYucAkjuBzPOSlIjog/viewform

The post Women as Key Players in Development – Open dialogue with G7 & G20 stakeholders first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.

item.title: Webinar on Civic Engagement with G7-BRICS-G20 Summits
item.dc:creator: c7Admin
item.description:
The PEOPLES’ 20 webinar on Civic Engagement with G7-BRICS-G20 Summits will be held on Thursday, 29 June 2023, at 2 PM (London) 6:30 PM (New Delhi) 8 PM (Bangkok) 10:00 PM (Seoul and Tokyo). One of the coordinators of the C7 Global Health Working Group, Masaki Inaba, will be speaking at the webinar. Webinar on […]

The post Webinar on Civic Engagement with G7-BRICS-G20 Summits first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.
item.content:encoded:
The PEOPLES’ 20 webinar on Civic Engagement with G7-BRICS-G20 Summits will be held on Thursday, 29 June 2023, at 2 PM (London) 6:30 PM (New Delhi) 8 PM (Bangkok) 10:00 PM (Seoul and Tokyo). One of the coordinators of the C7 Global Health Working Group, Masaki Inaba, will be speaking at the webinar.

Webinar on Civic Engagement with G7-BRICS-G20 Summits
29 June 2023 (Thursday)

Zoom: https://bit.ly/3InGsSp

The webinar, jointly organized by PEOPOES’ 20, AEPF and POP Dialogue aims to address the challenges, foster a common understanding, and formulate effective advocacy strategies pertaining to the triple annual ‘geopolitical’ summits, namely G7, BRICS and G20 among CSOs in Asia and Europe.

This is a follow-up to the virtual session on Nexus Approach to G7-BRICS-G20 at the PyeongChang-Odaesan-Peace (POP) Global Forum (8 Feb. 2023) (115) G20, G7, BRICS versusInclusive Multilateralism – Jomo Kwame Sundaram – YouTube

 

Guiding questions:

Taking into account the PPT presentation by Jomo Sundaram, please respond to the following questions based on your experiences (2-3 minutes per question per person)

  1. What are emerging geopolitical challenges from G7, G20 and BRICS Summits in terms of global CSO advocacy for peace, justice and equality?
  2. What is your critical assessment of the CSO engagement and advocacy so far with them – G7, BRICS and G20 Summits? What are the challenges facing the CSOs?
  3. What are your suggestions for effective strategies among CSOs in Asia and Europe in terms of international advocacy strategies?

 

Contact: Peoples20G20Summit@gmail.com

Time Zone: 2 PM (London), 6:30 PM (New Delhi) 8 PM (Bangkok), 10:00 PM (Seoul and Tokyo)

 

Program Agenda and Timeline:

The post Webinar on Civic Engagement with G7-BRICS-G20 Summits first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.

item.title: G7 Gender Equality Ministers and Civil Society Dialogue
item.dc:creator: c7Admin
item.description:
G7 Gender Equality Ministers and Civil Society Dialogue Monday, June 26, 16:30-19:00 JST/ 9:30-12:00 CEST Registration: https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_3q7sXMvsRLu15K9VWTTQqw (Online participation only) As a follow-up to the G7 Ministerial Meeting on Gender Equality and Women’s Empowerment in Nikko on 24th and 25th June 2023, the W7 Japan would like to create a space for dialogue between the […]

The post G7 Gender Equality Ministers and Civil Society Dialogue first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.
item.content:encoded:
G7 Gender Equality Ministers and Civil Society Dialogue

Monday, June 26, 16:30-19:00 JST/ 9:30-12:00 CEST

Registration: https://us06web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_3q7sXMvsRLu15K9VWTTQqw
(Online participation only)

As a follow-up to the G7 Ministerial Meeting on Gender Equality and Women’s Empowerment in Nikko on 24th and 25th June 2023, the W7 Japan would like to create a space for dialogue between the G7 Ministers on Gender Equality or their Representatives and the Civil Society, on gender equality, women’s leadership and human rights.

This will cover issues such as care economy, eradication of violence and bodily autonomy, digital world, LGBTQI+ and accountability.

The purpose of this Dialogue is to discuss the outcomes of the Gender Equality Ministers’ Meeting with Civil Society, and to carry the momentum to the next G7 Presidency – Italy.

The meeting will be opened by remarks of the Japan State Minister on Gender Equality and Women’s Empowerment, Mr. Masanobu Ogura, and the EU Commissioner for Equality, Ms Helena Dalli, followed by speeches by other G7 Ministers/representatives, and civil society representatives.

*Please see the attached program for more details!

Date/hour
Monday, 26th June, 2023
16:30h – 19:00 JST / 9.30 – 12.00 CEST

Location
ZOOM (Online)

Languages
English / Japanese (simultaneous interpretation); Japanese Sign Language Available / Notetaker Available.

Hosts
Delegation of European Union to Japan/ W7 Japan

Supported by
the Gender Equality Bureau, Cabinet Office, Japan

W7 is the G7’s official engagement group of feminist civil society promoting gender equality & women’s rights. (W7 Secretariat – w7japan2023@gmail.com)

Program details: June 26 EUDEL W7_Event Program

The post G7 Gender Equality Ministers and Civil Society Dialogue first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.

item.title: [21 May] Press release at the ultimate day of the G7 summit: Does the G7 communique’s pandemic/global health policies meet the world’s expectations?
item.dc:creator: c7Admin
item.description:

In response to the G7 summit communique’s global health contents, we will share information on the extent to which the global expectations regarding post-covid pandemic responses, UHC, SDG 3’s various health goals (including HIV/AIDS, […]

The post [21 May] Press release at the ultimate day of the G7 summit: Does the G7 communique’s pandemic/global health policies meet the world’s expectations? first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.
item.content:encoded:
Press release at the ultimate day of the G7 summit: Does the G7 communique’s pandemic/global health policies meet the world’s expectations?

In response to the G7 summit communique’s global health contents, we will share information on the extent to which the global expectations regarding post-covid pandemic responses, UHC, SDG 3’s various health goals (including HIV/AIDS, Tuberculosis, Malaria) have been met, alongside points of concern.

Date & Time: 16:00-17:00, 21st May 2023

Venue: Recreation Room, Hiroshima City Youth Center (2nd floor)

Participants: ※The listed participants and topic may be subject to change.

Moderator: Masaki Inaba (C7 Global health working group domestic coordinator)

Civil society representatives

  • Access to medical care, humanitarian crises and health: Utako Kanasugi (Medecins Sans Frontieres Japan advocacy manager)
  • Maternal and child health, nutrition: Yumiko Horie (Save the Children Japan advocacy manager)
  • Elderly health: Noriyo Washizu (Alzheimer’s Association Japan director)

Contacts:

Africa Japan Forum Global Health team (Masaki Inaba, Takakiyo Koizumi, Taimu Fujita)
e-mail: ajf.globalhealth@gmail.com
Mobile: 090-1264-8110 (Masaki)

Program:

  • Welcome by moderator
  • Analysis of/response to the global health section of the Hiroshima Summit communique
  • Issues around G7 Summit and Health
    • Pandemic preparedness and access to health/humanitarian crises and health
    • Maternal and child health, nutrition
    • Elderly health
  • Q&A
  • Closing remarks

The post [21 May] Press release at the ultimate day of the G7 summit: Does the G7 communique’s pandemic/global health policies meet the world’s expectations? first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.

The post [21 May] Press Conference by Setsuko Thurlow and ICAN first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.
item.content:encoded:
Press Conference by Setsuko Thurlow and ICAN

A press conference to provide Setsuko Thurlow’s message and ICAN’s response to G7 Summit’s outcomes. This will be the only opportunity in which Setsuko Thurlow will be speaking to the media.

Date: Sunday May 21, 16:00-17:00 (JST), 2023
Venue: 2nd Room, Hiroshima Youth Center (NGO Space) 5-61 Motomachi, Naka Ward, Hiroshima City

Speakers:

  • Part 1 – Setsuko Thurlow (Hibakusha)
  • Part 2 – Daniel Högsta (Interim Executive Director, ICAN), Akira Kawasaki (International Steering Group Member, ICAN / Executive Committee, Peace Boat)

Language: English and Japanese
Contact: Hatakeyama Sumiko, Peace Boat (+81-7085772576)

 

SPEAKER PROFILES:

Setsuko Thurlow

Hiroshima survivor and ICAN campaigner Setsuko Thurlow was a 13-year-old schoolgirl when the United States dropped an atomic bomb on her city, Hiroshima. Today, she is a leading figure in the International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN). Her powerful speeches have inspired countless individuals around the world to take action for disarmament. She was instrumental in the creation of the landmark Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons, adopted in July 2017 with the support of 122 nations. For decades, she has warned governments that inaction is not an option: nuclear weapons must be totally eliminated if we are to ensure that no other city ever suffers the same fate as hers. Setsuko’s courageous advocacy, sharp analysis and deep conviction make her a formidable opponent to all who claim that these ultimate weapons of mass destruction are legitimate instruments of defence. A living witness to the horrors of nuclear war, she has contributed enormously to the success of ICAN over the past decade.

 

Daniel Högsta

Interim Executive Director, International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN) From 1 February 2023, Daniel Högsta is taking on the Interim Executive Director role, after the departure of Beatrice Fihn, until a new Executive Director is found. ICAN is the 2017 Nobel Peace Prize-winning campaign coalition that works to prohibit and eliminate nuclear weapons. Previously, Daniel was the Campaign Coordinator of ICAN, responsible for the ICAN Cities Appeal, the ICAN Parliamentary Pledge, as well as supporting the campaign activities and political engagement of ICAN’s partner organisations. In the period which culminated in the negotiations of the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons (TPNW), Daniel coordinated advocacy efforts for ICAN and was responsible for generating awareness, understanding and support among governments for the “Humanitarian Initiative” and for the concept of a new treaty to ban nuclear weapons. During the negotiation of the TPNW in New York in 2017, he helped to lead ICAN’s lobbying team to ensure the Treaty reflected ICAN’s core principles. Since 2018, Daniel’s work focused on supporting the work of ICAN partners to garner political support for the Treaty in “nuclear umbrella” state contexts, as well as on broadening the community of stakeholders that champion the TPNW. He has degrees in Political Science and Law from the University of Michigan at Ann Arbor and the University of Edinburgh respectively.

 

Kawasaki Akira

Executive Committee member, Peace Boat International Steering Group member, International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN) Kawasaki Akira is a member of the Executive Committee of Peace Boat and sitting President and International Steering Group member of the International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN). Mr Kawasaki Akira served as Secretary-General of Peace Depot (2000-2002) and joined Peace Boat in 2003. Since 2008, he coordinates the “Global Voyage for a Nuclear-Free World: Peace Boat Hibakusha Project,” in which atomic-bomb survivors travel around the world to raise public awareness on nuclear dangers. In 2009-2010, he served as an NGO Advisor to the Co-Chairs of the International Commission on Nuclear Non-Proliferation and Disarmament (ICNND). Kawasaki joined the International Campaign to Abolish Nuclear Weapons (ICAN) for Peace Boat in 2010 and served as Co-chair (2012-2014), leading the campaign to be awarded the 2017 Nobel Peace Prize. From 2021, he serves as President of the Swiss-registered association of ICAN. As a Co-Chair of the Japan NGO Network for Nuclear Weapons Abolition, he has promoted dialogue on nuclear policy between the Japanese government, parliamentarians and civil society organizations. Kawasaki is a board member of the Peace Studies Association of Japan and lectures at Keisen University. He was awarded the 33rd Kiyoshi Tanimoto Peace Prize by Hiroshima Peace Center in 2021.

 

*Photo credit: International campaign to abolish nuclear weapons, proud supporters of the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons and Nobel Peace Prize winner 2017.

www.icanw.org

The post [21 May] Press Conference by Setsuko Thurlow and ICAN first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.

We will analyse and evaluate the G7 Leaders’ Communique from a civil society perspective and see if the content of the Civil7 Communique is reflected. Schedule: […]

The post [21 May] Civil7 Press Conference on the G7 Leaders’ Communique first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.
item.content:encoded:
Civil7 Press Conference on the G7 Leaders’ Communique

As one of the G7 official Engagement Groups, Civil7 (C7) is to hold a press conference on the G7 Leaders’ Communique. We will analyse and evaluate the G7 Leaders’ Communique from a civil society perspective and see if the content of the Civil7 Communique is reflected.

Schedule: 15:00 –15:50, 21st May, 2023

Venue:

  • In-person: 2nd room, NGO Center (Hiroshima City Youth Center)
  • Online (Zoom)

Language: English

RSVP: https://zoom.us/meeting/register/tJEkf-2hqT4uGdBnF6TPchQFqQnZxT9sFHoR

Speakers:

  • Mariko Kinai (Civil7 Steering Committee / World Vision Japan)
  • Hiroki Matsubara (Civil7 Steering Committee / Hiroshima NPO Center)
  • Risa Endo (Coordinator of the Civil7 Climate and Environmental Justice Working Group, JACSES)
  • Shoko Uchida (Coordinator of the Civil7 Economic Justice and Transformation Working Group, PARC)
  • Masaki Inaba (Coordinator of the Civil7 Global Health Working Group, Africa Japan Forum)
  • Yuko Shibata (Coordinator of the Civil7 Humanitarian Assistance and Conflict Working Group, Japan Platform)
  • Hirotaka Koike (Coordinator of the Civil7 Open and Resilient Societies Working Group, Greenpeace Japan)
  • Sumiko Hatakeyama (Coordinator of the Civil7 Nuclear Disarmament Working Group, Peace Boat)

Moderator: Aoi Horiuchi (Civil7 Steering Committee / JANIC)

Organizer: Civil7

 

The post [21 May] Civil7 Press Conference on the G7 Leaders’ Communique first appeared on CIVIL SOCIETY 7 - 2023 JAPAN.
